name: Blaziken
flavorText: Flames spout from its wrists, enveloping its knuckles. Its punches scorch its foes.
Attack1Text: Search your discard pile for a Fire Energy card and attach it to 1 of your Pokemon.
Attack2Text: Discard 2 Fire Energy attached to Blaziken. This attack does 80 damage to 1 of your opponent's Pokemon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokemon.)

name: Cresselia
flavorText: Shiny particles are released from its wings like a veil. It is said to represent the crescent moon.
Attack1Text: If there is any Stadium card in play, remove 2 damage counters from Cresselia.
Attack2Text: You may discard 2 Energy attached to Cresselia. If you do, remove all damage counters from 1 of your Benched Pokemon.

name: Darkrai
flavorText: It can lull people to sleep and make them dream. It is active during nights of the new moon.
Attack1Text: Search your deck for an Energy card, show it to your opponent, and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.
Attack2Text: If the Defending Pokemon is Cresselia, this attack's base damage is 100.

name: Darkrai
flavorText: It can lull people to sleep and make them dream. It is active during nights of the new moon.
Attack1Text: You may have your opponent switch the Defending Pokemon with 1 or his or her Benched Pokemon.
Attack2Text: If the Defending Pokemon is Asleep, this attack does 40 damage plus 40 more damage. If the Defending Pokemon is not Asleep, that Pokemon is now Asleep.

name: Pachirisu
flavorText: It makes fur balls that crackle with static electricity. It stores them with berries in tree holes.
Attack1Text: Search your deck for up to 3 Basic Pokemon and put them onto your Bench. Shuffle your deck afterward.
Attack2Text: If the Defending Pokemon has a Pokemon Tool card attached to it, this attack does 10 damage plus 30 more damage. Discard that Pokemon Tool card, look at your opponent's hand, and discard any Pokemon Tool cards of the same name you find there.

name: Porygon-Z
flavorText: Additional software was installed to make it a better Pokemon. It began acting oddly, however.
Ability1Text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may discard a basic Energy card from your hand. Porygon-Z is the same type as that Energy Card until the end of your turn. This power can't be used if Porygon-Z is affected by a Special Condition.
Attack1Text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 40 damage times the number of heads.

name: Rotom
flavorText: Its body is composed of plasma. It is known to infiltrate electronic devices and wreak havoc.
Attack1Text: Choose 1 card from your opponent's hand without looking. Look at that card you chose, then have your opponent shuffle that card into his or her deck.
Attack2Text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 30 damage plus 30 more damage and the Defending Pokemon is now Paralyzed.

name: Sceptile
flavorText: The leaves that grow on its arms can slice down thick trees. It is without peer in jungle combat.
Ability1Text: Each basic Grass Energy card attached to your Grass Pokemon provides GrassGrass Energy instead. You can't use more than 1 Wild Growth Poke-Body each turn.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 50 damage plus 20 more damage.

name: Swampert
flavorText: It can swim while towing a large ship. It bashes down foes with a swing of its thick arms.
Ability1Text: As often as you like during your turn (before your attack), you may move a Water or Fighting Energy attached to 1 of your Benched Pokemon to your Active Pokemon. This power can't be used if Swampert is affected by a Special Condition.
Attack1Text: Discard the top card from your opponent's deck.

name: Tangrowth
flavorText: It ensnares prey by extending arms made of vines. Losing arms to predators does not trouble it.
Attack1Text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokemon. This attack does 10 damage for each basic Energy card attached to Tangrowth to that Pokemon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokemon.)
Attack2Text: Remove 3 damage counters from Tangrowth. The Defending Pokemon can't retreat during your opponent's next turn.

name: Togekiss
flavorText: It will never appear where there is strife. Its sightings have become rare recently.
Ability1Text: Once during your turn, when you play Togekiss from your hand to evolve 1 of your Pokemon, you may look at the top 10 cards of your deck, choose as many basic Energy cards as you like, and attach them to your Pokemon in any way you like. Put the other cards back on top of your deck. Shuffle your deck afterward.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 40 damage plus 30 more damage. If tails, remove 3 damage counters from Togekiss.

name: Altaria
flavorText: It looks like a fluffy cloud when it is in flight. It hums with its soprano voice.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing. If heads, the Defending Pokemon is now Paralyzed.
Attack2Text: During your opponent's next turn, any damage done to Altaria by attacks from your opponent's Evolved Pokemon is reduced by 30 (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

name: Beedrill
flavorText: Its best attack involves flying around at high speed, striking with poison needles, then flying off.
Attack1Text: Does 30 damage times the number of Beedrill you have in play.
Attack2Text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 50 damage times the number of heads.

name: Butterfree
flavorText: It loves the honey of flowers and can locate flower patches that have even tiny amounts of pollen.
Attack1Text: After your attack, remove from 1 of your Pokemon the number of damage counters equal to the damage you did to the Defending Pokemon.
Attack2Text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokemon is now Asleep. If tails, the Defending Pokemon is now Poisoned.

name: Claydol
flavorText: An ancient clay figurine that came to life as a Pokemon from exposure to a mysterious ray of light.
Ability1Text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may choose up to 2 cards from your hand and put them on the bottom of your deck in any order. If you do, draw cards until you have 6 cards in your hand. This power can't be used if Claydol is affected by a Special Condition.

name: Dialga
flavorText: It has the power to control time. It appears in Sinnoh-region myths as an ancient deity.
Attack1Text: Draw a card.
Attack2Text: You may return all Energy cards attached to Dialga to your hand. If you do, remove the highest Stage Evolution card from the Defending Pokemon and shuffle that card into your opponent's deck.

name: Exploud
flavorText: Its howls can be heard over six miles away. It emits all sorts of noises from the ports on its body.
Attack1Text: Flip 2 coins. If the first coin is heads, this attack does 50 damage to the Defending Pokemon. If the first coin is tails, this attack does 20 damage to each of your opponent's Benched Pokemon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokemon.) If the second coin is heads, the Defending Pokemon is now Confused. If the second coin is tails, your opponent can't play any Trainer, Supporter, or Stadium cards from his or her hand during your opponent's next turn.

name: Houndoom
flavorText: Long ago, people imagined its eerie howls to be the call of the grim reaper.
Attack1Text: Choose 1 card from your opponent's hand without looking and discard it.
Attack2Text: You may discard a Fire or Darkness Energy attached to Houndoom. If you discard a Fire Energy, the Defending Pokemon is now Burned. If you discard a Darkness Energy, this attack does 40 damage plus 30 more damage.

name: Hypno
flavorText: Seeing its swinging pendulum can induce sleep in three seconds, even if someone just woke up.
Attack1Text: If the Defending Pokemon is Asleep, move all damage counters from Hypno to the Defending Pokemon.
Attack2Text: The Defending Pokemon is now Asleep.

name: Kingler
flavorText: The larger pincer has 10,000-horsepower strength. However, it is so heavy, it is difficult to aim.
Attack2Text: If the Defending Pokemon would be be Knocked Out by this attack, Kingler does 30 damage to itself.

name: Lapras
flavorText: It loves crossing the sea with people and Pokemon on its back. It understands human speech.
Attack1Text: Search your deck for a Pokemon Tool Card, a Supporter card, and a basic Energy card, show them to your opponent, and put them into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

name: Latias
flavorText: Its body is covered with a down that can refract light in such a way that it becomes invisible.
Attack1Text: Remove 2 damage counters and all Special Conditions from Latias.
Attack2Text: Discard a Fire Energy and a Water Energy attached to Latias.

name: Latios
flavorText: A highly intelligent Pokemon. By folding back its wings in flight, it can overtake jet planes.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, search your deck for a basic Energy card and attach it to Latios. Shuffle your deck afterward.
Attack2Text: Discard 3 Energy attached to Latios.

name: Mawile
flavorText: Attached to its head is a huge set of jaws formed by horns. It can chew through iron beams.
Attack1Text: Choose 1 face-down Prize card (yours or your opponent's) and put it face up. If that card is a Supporter card, use the effect of that card as the effect of this attack. (That card remains face up for the rest of the game.)
Attack2Text: During your next turn, if an attack does damage to the Defending Pokemon (after applying Weakness and Resistance), that attack does 20 more damage.

name: Milotic
flavorText: When people bicker, it is said to arise from the depths of lakes to becalm violent hearts.
Ability1Text: Prevent all effects of attacks, including damage, done to Milotic by your opponent's Pokemon LV.X.
Attack1Text: Flip 2 coins. If both are tails, this attack does nothing. For each heads, discard an Energy attached to the Defending Pokemon.

name: Palkia
flavorText: It has the ability to distort space. It is described as a deity in Sinnoh-region mythology.
Attack1Text: Search your deck for a Stadium card, show it to your opponent, and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward. If there is any Stadium card in play, discard it.
Attack2Text: You may flip a coin. If heads, discard all Energy attached to Palkia and put the Defending Pokemon and all cards attached to it on top of your opponent's deck. Your opponent shuffles his or her deck afterward.

name: Primeape
flavorText: It grows angry if you see its eyes and gets angrier if you run. If you beat it, it gets even madder.
Ability1Text: If Primeape has any damage counters on it, Primeape's attacks do 40 more damage to the Active Pokemon (before applying Weakness and Resistance).
Attack1Text: Primeape is now Confused. Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokemon can't attack during your opponent's next turn.

name: Slowking
flavorText: Being bitten by Shellder gave it intelligence comparable to that of award-winning scientists.
Ability1Text: Once during your turn (before your attack), if any of your Pokemon were Knocked Out during your opponent's last turn, search your deck for any 1 card and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward. This power can't be used if Slowking is affected by a Special Condition.
Attack1Text: During your next turn, Slowking's Psych Up attack's base damage is 60.

name: Unown [H]
flavorText: Shaped like ancient writing, it is a huge mystery whether language or UNOWN came first.
Ability1Text: Once during your turn (before your attack), if you have Unown H, Unown E, Unown A, and Unown L on your Bench, you may remove all Special Conditions from 1 of your Active Pokemon.
Attack1Text: Discard a card from your hand. (If you can't discard a card from your hand, this attack does nothing.)

name: Wailord
flavorText: The biggest of all Pokemon. It can dive to a depth of almost 10,000 feet on only one breath.
Ability1Text: As long as Wailord remains Asleep between turns, remove 1 damage counter from Wailord.
Attack1Text: If Wailord has any damage counters on it, Wailord is now Asleep.

name: Weezing
flavorText: It grows by feeding on gases released by garbage. Though very rare, triplets have been found.
Ability1Text: At any time between turns, each player puts 1 more damage counter on his or her Poisoned Pokemon.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokemon is now Confused and Poisoned.

name: Wigglytuff
flavorText: Its fine fur feels sublime to the touch. It can expand its body by inhaling air.
Ability1Text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may use this power. Each Active Pokemon (both yours and your opponent's) is now Asleep. This power can't be used if Wigglytuff is affected by a Special Condition.
Attack1Text: If Igglybuff is anywhere under Wigglytuff, this attack does 40 damage plus 20 more damage.

name: Arbok
flavorText: The pattern on its belly is for intimidation. It constricts foes while they are frozen in fear.
Attack1Text: If the Defending Pokemon is Poisoned, this attack does 10 damage plus 40 more damage. If the Defending Pokemon is not Poisoned, that Pokemon is now Poisoned.
Attack2Text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokemon is now Paralyzed.

name: Cacturne
flavorText: It becomes active at night, seeking prey that is exhausted from the day's desert heat.
Attack1Text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 20 damage times the number of heads.
Attack2Text: If the Defending Pokemon already has any damage counters on it, this attack does 50 damage plus 20 more damage.

name: Combusken
flavorText: Its kicking mastery lets it loose 10 kicks per second. It emits sharp cries to intimidate foes.
Attack1Text: During your next turn, each of Combusken's attacks does 30 more damage to the Defending Pokemon (before applying Weakness and Resistance).
Attack2Text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 50 damage times the number of heads.

name: Delibird
flavorText: It carries food rolled up in its tail. It has the habit of sharing food with people lost in mountains.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, search your deck for any 1 card and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

name: Floatzel
flavorText: It floats using its well-developed floatation sac. It assists in the rescues of drowning people.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, prevent all effects of an attack, including damage, done to Floatzel during your opponent's next turn.
Attack2Text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokemon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokemon.)

name: Gorebyss
flavorText: It lives at the bottom of the sea. In the springtime, its pink body turns more vivid for some reason.
Attack1Text: Switch 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokemon with 1 of the Defending Pokemon. This attack does 10 damage to the new Defending Pokemon.
Attack2Text: If Gorebyss has any Psychic Energy attached to it, this attack does 30 damage plus 20 more damage and the Defending Pokemon is now Confused.

name: Granbull
flavorText: It is timid in spite of its looks. If it becomes enraged, however, it will strike with its huge fangs.
Attack1Text: During your opponent's next turn, any damage done by attacks from the Defending Pokemon is reduced by 20 (before applying Weakness and Resistance).
Attack2Text: Does 40 damage plus 10 more damage for each damage counter on Granbull.

name: Grovyle
flavorText: It lives in dense jungles. While closing in on its prey, it leaps from branch to branch.
Attack1Text: Search your deck for up to 2 Grass Energy cards, show them to your opponent, and put them into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.
Attack2Text: The Defending Pokemon is now Poisoned.

name: Hariyama
flavorText: It loves to match power with big-bodied Pokemon. It can knock a truck flying with its arm thrusts.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 damage plus 40 more damage.
Attack2Text: If Hariyama has fewer remaining HP than the Defending Pokemon, this attack's base damage is 80.

name: Huntail
flavorText: It lives deep in the sea. With a tail shaped like a small fish, it attracts unsuspecting prey.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokemon can't attack or retreat during your opponent's next turn.
Attack2Text: If Huntail has any Darkness Energy attached to it, this attack does 30 damage plus 20 more damage and discard a Special Energy card, if any, attached to the Defending Pokemon.

name: Linoone
flavorText: It charges prey at speeds over 60 mph. However, because it can only run straight, it often fails.
Attack1Text: Move a Pokemon Tool card attached to 1 of your opponent's Pokemon to another of your opponent's Pokemon (excluding Pokemon that already has a Pokemon Tool attached to it). (If an effect of this attack is prevented, this attack does nothing.)
Attack2Text: Does 30 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokemon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokemon.)

name: Loudred
flavorText: The shock waves from its cries can tip over trucks. It stamps its feet to power up.
Attack1Text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokemon. This attack does 20 damage to that Pokemon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokemon.)
Attack2Text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 40 damage plus 20 more damage.

name: Magcargo
flavorText: Its body temperature is roughly 18,000 degrees F. Flames spout from gaps in its hardened shell.
Ability1Text: Magcargo can't be Asleep or Paralyzed.
Attack1Text: You may discard the top card of your deck. If you do, the Defending Pokemon is now Burned.

name: Marshtomp
flavorText: Its sturdy legs give it sure footing, even in mud. It burrows into dirt to sleep.
Attack2Text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokemon. This attack does 30 damage to that Pokemon and 10 damage to each of your opponent's other Pokemon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokemon.)

name: Metapod
flavorText: A steel-hard shell protects its tender body. It quietly endures hardships while awaiting evolution.
Ability1Text: Once during your turn (before your attack), if Metapod is your Active Pokemon, you may flip a coin. If heads, search your deck for a card that evolves from Metapod and put it onto Metapod. (This counts as evolving Metapod.) Shuffle your deck afterward. This power can't be used if Metapod is affected by a Special Condition.

name: Pelipper
flavorText: It dips its large bill in the sea, then scoops up numerous prey along with water.
Attack1Text: Choose up to 2 basic Water Energy cards from your hand and attach them to Pelipper. Remove 2 damage counters for each Energy card attached in this way.
Attack2Text: Does 30 times the number of Energy cards attached to Pelipper. Then, put all Energy cards attached to Pelipper on top of your deck. Shuffle your deck afterward.

name: Porygon2
flavorText: With planetary development software installed, it became capable of working in space.
Ability1Text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may discard a Supporter card from your hand and use the effect of that card as the effect of this power. This power can't be used if Porygon2 is affected by a Special Condition.

name: Purugly
flavorText: It is a brazen brute that barges its way into another Pokemon's nest and claims it as its own.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, discard an Energy attached to the Defending Pokemon.
Attack2Text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 40 damage times the number of heads.

name: Relicanth
flavorText: A rare Pokemon discovered during a deep-sea exploration. It has not changed in over 100 million years.
Attack1Text: Search your deck for up to 3 Trainer Cards that have Fossil in their names, show them to your opponent, and put them into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.
Attack2Text: Both Relicanth and the Defending Pokemon are now Asleep.

name: Seviper
flavorText: For many generations, it has feuded with ZANGOOSE. It whets its bladed tail on rocks for battle.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent can't play any Trainer cards from his or her hand during your opponent's next turn.
Attack2Text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 30 damage plus 30 more damage and the Defending Pokemon is now Poisoned.

name: Skarmory
flavorText: Despite being clad entirely in iron-hard armor, it flies at speeds over 180 mph.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, discard an Energy attached to the Defending Pokemon.
Attack2Text: During your opponent's next turn, any damage done to Skarmory by attacks is reduced by 20 (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

name: Slowbro
flavorText: Though usually dim witted, it seems to become inspired if the SHELLDER on its tail bites down.
Attack1Text: Choose 1 of the Defending Pokemon's attacks. That Pokemon can't use that attack during your opponent's next turn.

name: Togetic
flavorText: It is said to appear in front of kindly people to scatter a glowing down called "joy dust."
Attack2Text: Your opponent may draw a card.

name: Unown [F]
flavorText: Shaped like ancient writing, it is a huge mystery whether language or UNOWN came first.
Ability1Text: Once during your turn (before your attack), if Unown F is on your Bench, you may use this power. Put a coin next to your Active Pokemon without showing your opponent and cover it with your hand. Your opponent guesses if the coin is heads or tails. If he or she is wrong, draw a card.
Attack1Text: You may flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing. If heads, this attack's base damage is 30.

name: Unown [G]
flavorText: Shaped like ancient writing, it is a huge mystery whether language or UNOWN came first.
Ability1Text: Once during your turn (before your attack), if Unown G is on your Bench, you may discard all cards attached to Unown G and attach Unown G to 1 of your Pokemon as a Pokemon Tool card. As long as Unown G is attached to a Pokemon, prevent all effects of attacks, excluding damage, done to that Pokemon.
Attack1Text: If Unown G has any damage counters on it, this attack's base damage is 10.

name: Wailmer
flavorText: On sunny days, it lands on beaches to bounce like a ball and play. It spouts water from its nose.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 damage to each of your opponent's Benched Pokemon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokemon.)

name: Zangoose
flavorText: It has feuded with SEVIPER for many generations. Its sharp claws are its biggest weapons.
Attack2Text: If your opponent has Seviper in play, this attack does 40 damage plus 50 more damage.

name: Baltoy
flavorText: It moves by spinning on its foot. It is a rare Pokemon that was discovered in ancient ruins.
Attack1Text: If you have less cards in your hand than your opponent, draw cards until you have the same number of cards as your opponent. (If you have more or the same number of cards in your hand as your opponent, this attack does nothing.)
Attack2Text: Switch Baltoy with 1 of your Benched Pokemon.

name: Buizel
flavorText: It has a flotation sac that is like an inflatable collar. It floats on water with its head out.

name: Cacnea
flavorText: By storing water in its body, this desert dweller can survive 30 days without water.
Attack1Text: If the Defending Pokemon tries to attack during your opponent's next turn, your opponent flips a coin. If tails, that attack does nothing.
Attack2Text: The Defending Pokemon is now Poisoned.

name: Caterpie
flavorText: It releases a stench from its red antenna to repel enemies. It grows by molting repeatedly.
Ability1Text: Once during your turn (before your attack), if Caterpie is your Active Pokemon, you may flip a coin. If heads, search your deck for a card that evolves from Caterpie and put it onto Caterpie. (This counts as evolving Caterpie.) Shuffle your deck afterward. This power can't be used if Caterpie is affected by a Special Condition.

name: Clamperl
flavorText: It makes a single pearl during its lifetime. The pearl is said to amplify psychic power.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing. If heads, the Defending Pokemon is now Paralyzed.

name: Drowzee
flavorText: It can tell what people are dreaming by sniffing with its big nose. It loves fun dreams.
Attack1Text: The Defending Pokemon is now Asleep.

name: Ekans
flavorText: It sneaks through grass without making a sound and strikes unsuspecting prey from behind.
Attack1Text: Remove 2 damage counters from Ekans.
Attack2Text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokemon is now Poisoned.

name: Feebas
flavorText: It is famous for its shabby appearance. While populous, they tend to cluster in set locations.
Attack2Text: Search your deck for an Evolution card, show it to your opponent, and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

name: Glameow
flavorText: It claws if displeased and purrs when affectionate. Its fickleness is very popular among some.
Attack1Text: Switch 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokemon with 1 of the Defending Pokemon.

name: Houndour
flavorText: It conveys its feelings using different cries. It works in a pack to cleverly take down prey.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If tails, discard a Fire Energy attached to Houndour.

name: Igglybuff
flavorText: It has a soft and bouncy body. Once it starts bouncing, it becomes impossible to stop.
Ability1Text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may put Jigglypuff from your hand onto Igglybuff (this counts as evolving Igglybuff) and remove all damage counters from Igglybuff.
Attack1Text: Draw a card. If you didn't play any Supporter card from your hand during this turn, draw 2 more cards.

name: Illumise
flavorText: With its sweet aroma, it guides VOLBEAT to draw signs with light in the night sky.
Ability1Text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may flip a coin. If heads, search your deck for a Grass Basic Pokemon and put it onto your Bench. Shuffle your deck afterward. This power can't be used if Illumise is affected by a Special Condition.
Attack1Text: If the Defending Pokemon has any Poke-Bodies, that Pokemon is now Asleep.

name: Jigglypuff
flavorText: When it wavers its big, round eyes, it begins singing a lullaby that makes everyone drowsy.
Attack1Text: The Defending Pokemon is now Asleep.
Attack2Text: During your opponent's next turn, any damage done to Jigglypuff by attacks is reduced by 20 (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

name: Kakuna
flavorText: While awaiting evolution, it hides from predators under leaves and in nooks of branches.
Attack1Text: During your opponent's next turn, any damage done to Kakuna by attacks is reduced by 30 (after applying Weakness and Resistance).
Attack2Text: The Defending Pokemon is now Poisoned.

name: Koffing
flavorText: Lighter-than-air gases in its body keep it aloft. The gases not only smell, they are also explosive.
Attack2Text: The Defending Pokemon is now Poisoned. If the Defending Pokemon tries to attack during your opponent's next turn, your opponent flips a coin. If tails, that attack does nothing.

name: Krabby
flavorText: It lives in burrows dug on sandy beaches. Its pincers fully grow back if they are broken in battle.

name: Lunatone
flavorText: Because it turns active on nights of the full moon, it is said to have some link to the lunar phases.
Ability1Text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may discard a card from your hand. Then, if you have Solrock in play, draw a card. This power can't be used if Lunatone is affected by a Special Condition.
Attack1Text: You may discard any Stadium card in play.

name: Luvdisc
flavorText: It lives in warm seas. It is said that a couple finding this Pokemon will be blessed with eternal love.
Attack1Text: Reveal the top card of your deck and put it into your hand. If that card is a Pokemon, draw 2 cards.
Attack2Text: If Luvdisc and the Defending Pokemon have the same amount of Energy attached to them, this attack does 10 damage plus 20 more damage.

name: Makuhita
flavorText: It toughens its body by slamming into thick trees. Many snapped trees can be found near its nest.
Attack2Text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing. If heads, discard an Energy card attached to the Defending Pokemon.

name: Mankey
flavorText: It lives in treetop colonies. If one becomes enraged, the whole colony rampages for no reason.
Attack2Text: Does 10 damage plus 10 more damage for each damage counter on Mankey.

name: Mudkip
flavorText: To alert it, the fin on its head senses the flow of water. It has the strength to heft boulders.
Attack2Text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 30 damage plus 20 more damage for each heads.

name: Porygon
flavorText: The world's first artificially created Pokemon. It can travel through electronic space.
Attack1Text: Look at the top 3 cards of your deck and put them back on top of your deck in any order.

name: Slowpoke
flavorText: Although slow, it is skilled at fishing with its tail. It does not feel pain if its tail is bitten.
Attack1Text: Remove all Special Conditions and 3 damage counters from Slowpoke. Slowpoke is now Asleep.
Attack2Text: Slowpoke can't attack during your next turn.

name: Slugma
flavorText: Its body is made of magma. If it doesn't keep moving, its body will cool and harden.
Attack2Text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokemon is now Paralyzed.

name: Snubbull
flavorText: Small Pokemon flee from its scary face. It is, however, considered by women to be cute.
Attack1Text: Your opponent switches the Defending Pokemon with 1 of his or her Benched Pokemon.

name: Solrock
flavorText: A new Pokemon species, rumored to be from the sun. It gives off light while spinning.
Ability1Text: If you have Lunatone in play, damage done to your opponent's Pokemon by your Psychic or Fighting Pokemon isn't affected by resistance.
Attack1Text: Search your discard pile for a basic Energy card and attach it to 1 of your Benched Pokemon.

name: Swablu
flavorText: Its wings are like cotton tufts. If it perches on someone's head, it looks like a cotton hat.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, prevent all effects of an attack, including damage, done to Swablu during your opponent's next turn.
Attack2Text: Does 10 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokemon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokemon.)

name: Tangela
flavorText: It is shrouded by blue vines. No one has seen the face hidden behind this growth of vines.
Attack1Text: Switch 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokemon with 1 of the Defending Pokemon.
Attack2Text: Does 20 damage plus 10 more damage for each Colorless Energy in the Defending Pokemon's Retreat Cost (after applying effects to the the Retreat Cost).

name: Togepi
flavorText: Its shell is said to be stuffed with happiness that it shares with kindhearted people.
Attack1Text: The Defending Pokemon is now Asleep.
Attack2Text: Flip a coin. If heads, search your deck for a Pokemon, show it to your opponent, and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

name: Torchic
flavorText: A fire burns inside, so it feels very warm to hug. It launches fireballs of 1,800 degrees F.
Attack2Text: The Defending Pokemon is now Burned.

name: Treecko
flavorText: The soles of its feet are covered by countless tiny spikes, enabling it to walk on walls and ceilings.
Attack1Text: Does 10 damage plus 10 more damage for each Energy attached to Treecko but not used to pay for this attack's Energy cost. You can't add more than 20 damage in this way.
Attack2Text: Remove 1 damage counter from Treecko.

name: Unown [L]
flavorText: Shaped like ancient writing, it is a huge mystery whether language or UNOWN came first.
Ability1Text: Unown L can use any attack from any Unown in play (both yours and your opponent's). (You still have to pay for that attack's Energy cost.)
Attack1Text: Search either player's discard pile for up to any 2 cards, show them to your opponent, and put them on top of that player's deck in any order you like.

name: Volbeat
flavorText: It communicates with others by lighting up its rear at night. It loves ILLUMISE's sweet aroma.
Ability1Text: Once during your turn (before your attack), if you have Illumise in play, you may search your discard pile for a Supporter card, show it to your opponent, and put it on top of your deck. This power can't be used if Volbeat is affected by a Special Condition.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokemon is now Confused.

name: Weedle
flavorText: It eats its weight in leaves every day. It fends off attackers with the needle on its head.
Attack1Text: Search your deck for a Basic Pokemon and put it onto your Bench. Shuffle your deck afterward.
Attack2Text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokemon is now Paralyzed.

name: Whismur
flavorText: Usually, its cries are like quiet murmurs.  If frightened, it shrieks at the same volume as a jet plane.
Attack2Text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 damage to each of your opponent's Pokemon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokemon.)

name: Wingull
flavorText: It makes its nest on steep sea cliffs. Riding updrafts, it soars to great heights.

name: Zigzagoon
flavorText: It walks in zigzag fashion. It is good at finding items in the grass and even in the ground.
Attack1Text: Search your discard pile for any 1 card, show it to your opponent, and put it on top of your deck.
Attack2Text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 10 damage times the number of heads.

name: Cresselia LV.X
Ability1Text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may move 1 damage counter from either player's Pokemon to another Pokemon (yours or your opponent's). This power can't be used if Cresselia is affected by a Special Condition.
Attack1Text: If the Defending Pokemon is Knocked Out by this attack, take 1 more Prize card.

name: Darkrai LV.X
Ability1Text: Each basic Darkness Energy card attached to your Darkness Pokemon now has the effect "If the Pokemon Darkness Energy is attached to attacks, the attack does 10 more damage to the Active Pokemon (before applying Weakness and Resistance)." You can't use more than 1 Dark Shadow Poke-Body each turn.
Attack1Text: The Defending Pokemon is now Asleep. Flip 2 coins instead of 1 between turns. If either of them is tails, the Defending Pokemon is still Asleep. If both of them are tails, the Defending Pokemon is Knocked Out.

name: Dialga LV.X
Ability1Text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may have your opponent flip 2 coins. If both of them are heads, your turn ends. If both of them are tails, after your opponent draws a card at the beginning of his or her next turn, his or her turn ends. This power can't be used if Dialga is affected by a Special Condition.
Attack1Text: During your next turn, Dialga can't use Metal Flash.

name: Palkia LV.X
Ability1Text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may have your opponent switch 1 of your Active Pokemon with 1 of your Benched Pokemon. Then, you switch 1 of the Defending Pokemon with 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokemon. This power can't be used if Palkia is affected by a Special Condition.
Attack1Text: You may move all Energy cards attached to Palkia to your Benched Pokemon in any way you like. (Ignore this effect if you don't have any Benched Pokemon.)
